intro: Humboltia subsinuata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed sarsaparilla, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has compound leaves with finely divided lobes. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, a common feature in the Apiaceae family. Humboltia subsinuata is also known for its use in traditional herbal medicine.
